V.iii.6.2.b
.
Testing Not Required for SC for GERD
A diagnosis of GERD for SC purposes does not require documentation by medical imaging.
38 CFR 4.114, DC 7206, Note (1)
requires “findings” to be documented by one of three types of imaging:  barium swallow, computed tomography (CT), or esophagogastroduodenoscopy.  This refers to documentation of esophageal stricture for evaluation purposes.  It does not define a sufficient diagnosis of GERD for SC purposes.
Note
:  A 10-percent evaluation for GERD can also be assigned pursuant to
38 CFR 4.7
without imaging to document esophageal stricture when the Veteran requires daily medications.
